1.title: Much at Steak
1.plot: There are many ways to cook steak. This show offers a few options. Recipes include: Wood-Grilled Beef Tomahawk with Blue Cheese Butter, Cherry-Smoked Strip Steak with Cutting Board Sauce and Bacon-Wrapped Albacore "Filet Mignons" with Peppercorn Cream Sauce.

2.title: Hot Stuff
2.plot: Fire is part of barbecue but this show focuses on fire of a different type, chilies and hot sauces. Recipes include: Nashville Hot Wings, Monroe County Pork Steaks with Spicy Vinegar Dip, Piri Piri Prawns and Tandori Lamb with Hell's Fury Salsa and Raita.

3.title: Fire Meets Water
3.plot: Seafood cooked with live fire. Recipes include: Salt Slab-Grilled Rockfish with Melon Mint Relish, Grill-Blackened Tuna with Cajun Remoulade, Grilled Shrimp with Deconstructed Pesto and Maple-Cured Smoked King Salmon.

4.title: Fire Birds
4.plot: There are four reasons to cook poultry on the grill: crisp skin, succulent meat, wood smoke and the joy of firing up your wood grill or smoker. Recipes include: Tabaka Chicken with Rhubarb Tkemali, Moroccan Grilled Chicken Kebabs with Charmoule, Grilled Pound Cake with Berry Salsa and Smoked Whipped Cream and Truffle-Smoked Turkey.

5.title: PAC-Rim Smoke
5.plot: Smoking foods is popular in most areas of the world but not so much in Asia. This show adds smoke to Asian dishes. Recipes include: Whole Grilled Striped Bass with Asian Aromatics, Coconut-Grilled Corn with Sesame Soy Butter, Grilled Thai Beef Salad and Char Siu Chicken Thighs with Beijing Barbecue Sauce.

6.title: Where There's Smoke
6.plot: This show is all about smoke. Recipes include: Cherry-Smoked Duck Breasts, Smoked Mushroom Bread Pudding, Project Smoke Chilies Rellenos and Texas Beef Clod with Mustard Barbecue Sauce.

7.title: Extreme Smoke
7.plot: This show has foods you'd never dream of smoking or grilling. Recipes include: "Egg on Eggs" - Grilled Sea Urchins, Grilled Veal Chops with Blowtorch-Smoked Rosemary, Caveman Lobster and Grilled King Crab with Absinthe Butter and Rotisserie Beef Plate Ribs with Fire-Roasted Onions and Peppers, Chiliean Salsa.

8.title: Perfect Hog
8.plot: This show isn't all about the "perfect hog." Recipes include: Pastami Bacon, Cider-Brined Pork Chops, Yankee Porchetta ("Pork and Beans") and Bacon-Wrapped Onion Rings.

9.title: BBQ's Trinity
9.plot: To Steven barbecue is a religion which includes the holy trinity: Brisket, Ribs and Pork Shoulder. Recipes include: Korean Pulled Pork with KB BBQ Sauce, Cherry-Glazed Baby Backs and BBQ Titans Brisket with Espresso Barbecue Sauce.

10.title: Mexican Smoke
10.plot: In Southern California the Mexican influence is everywhere. This show focuses on Mexican smoke. Recipes include: Ember-Roasted Salsa with Grilled Tortillas, Bacon, Bean and Egg Quesadillas, Chipotle-Marinated Pork Tenderloin with Grilled Nopalitos Corn Salad and Spice-Grilled Pineapple with Mezcal and Whipped Cream.

11.title: South American Smoke
11.plot: We head to South America where wood grilling and smoking have been a way of life for thousands of years. Recipes include: Peruvian Roast Chicken with Aji Amarillo Sauce, Choripan and Brazilian Churrasco (Mixed Grill) with Moiho a Campanha.

12.title: Global Tailgate
12.plot: Tailgating may be a uniquely American experience but competitive grill sessions are universal. Recipes include: Steak and Bean Nachos, Maple Sriracha-Smoked Chicken Legs, Project Smoke Four Bean Salad, Inside-Out Cheeseburgers with Homemade Ketchup, Lamb Burgers on Pita with Yogurt Sauce and Thai Flavor Veal Burgrs with Asian Peanut Sauce.

13.title: Project Smoke Road Trip
13.plot: We take a trip to The Hitching Post and show behind the scenes with our crew. Recipes include: Hitching Post Red Oak Grilled Rib Chop, Crispy Brisket Bean Tostadas and Grilled Whelk Kebabs with Herbs and Olive Oil.

1.title: Smoking 101
1.plot: Recipes include: Cold Smoked Scallops with Smoked Tomatoes, Jicama-Mango Salsa, Slow-Roasted Chicken with Horseradish Dip and Smoked Baby Back Ribs with Prickly Pear Barbecue Sauce.

2.title: Shoulders and Bellies
2.plot: How to turn undesirable items into gastronomic miracles. Recipes include: Barbecued Pork Belly, House-Cured Pastrami, Barbecued Lamb Shoulder with Black Dip and Smoked Manhattan.

3.title: Surf Meets Turf
3.plot: Smoked surf and turf is on the menu. Recipes include: Smoked Shrimp Cocktail with Chipotle Orange Sauce, Smoked Plamked Trout with Caper Dill Sauce, Reverse Seared Tri-Tip with Smoked Tomato Salsa and Tea-Smoked Duck with Hoisin Barbecue Sauce.

4.title: Ribs Rock the Smoker
4.plot: If ribs are your addiction Project Smoke has your fix. Recipes include: Big Bad Beef Ribs, Jamaican Jerk Spareribs, Smoked Slaw and Spicee-Smoked Lamb Ribs with Cherry Barbecue Sauce.

5.title: How to Smoke When You Don't Have a Smoker
5.plot: Maybe you don't have access to a smoker. This show explains how to smoke without a conventional smoker. Recipes include: Persian Smoked Eggplant Dip with Fried Mint, Smoked Gazpacho, Stovetop Kippered Salmon and Jamaican Jerk Chicken.

6.title: Big Bad Beef
6.plot: For many people, beef is the ultimate barbecue. Recipes include: Sriracha Beef Jerky, Slam Dunk Brisket, Smokehouse Beans and Whole Smoked Beef Tenderloin with Ember-Roasted Peppers.

7.title: Bacon 24/7
7.plot: From the beginning to the end of the day, bacon has become an obsession. Recipes include: Home Smoked Bacon, Canadian Bacon, Snow Crab Bacon Poppers and Tulsa Torpedo (Bacon Weave Sausage Roll).

8.title: Hog Wild
8.plot: Think of your favorite Smoked foods, most are from a pig. Recipes include: Smokehouse Ham, Smoke-tisserie Pork Loin Roast with Red-Eye Barbecue Sauce, Chorizo Barbecued Cabbage and West Virginia Pork Shoulder with Mustard Barbecue Sauce.

9.title: Thanksgiving Comes Early
9.plot: Thanksgiving comes early to Project Smoke and everything gets Smoked. Recipes include: Double Whiskey-Smoked Turkey, Barbecued Onions, Bacon-Apple Crisp and Smoked Creamed Corn.

10.title: Yum Kippers--Fish Gets Smoked!
10.plot: Lox, Sable and Kippers some of the greatest Smoked dishes come from the sea. Recipes include: Cold Smoked Salmon, Hot Smoked Black Cod, Coco Loco Smoked Crème Brulees and Smoked Wahoo with Mango Salsa.

11.title: Smoking the Competition--Our Tailgating Show
11.plot: The real competition is In the parking lot and gets more interesting when you fire up the smoker. Recipes include: Smoked Chicken Nachos, Smokehouse Wings, Double Brat Po' Boys with Smoked Sauerkraut and Hickory-Smoked Burgers with Rauchbier Cheese Sauce.

12.title: You Can Smoke What!? Extreme Smoking
12.plot: This shows foods you never thought you could smoke. Recipes include: Smoked Deviled Eggs, Plank-Smoked Camembert, Hay-Smoked Steak with Chipotle Salsa, Smoked Apples and Smoky Mary.

13.title: White Glove Smoke Session
13.plot: These recipes are designed to raise "smoking" to the level of art. Recipes include: Chipotle-Smoked Oysters, Smoke-tisserie Prime Rib with Wodd-Grilled Asparagus, Triple Smoked Potatoes and Smoked Cheesecake with Burnt Sugar Cream Sauce.

1.title: ABC's of Smoke
1.plot: Think of this as a crash course of smoking. Recipes include: Rotisserie-Smoked Chicken with Drip Pan Root Vegetablese Bourbon Brown Sugar Smoked Pork Loin, Smoke-Roasted Pears and Brisket on the Bone.

2.title: Bird Meets Smoke
2.plot: How to get crispy skin and great smoky flavor with poultry. Recipes include: Cherry-Smoked Duck with Chipotle Cherry Barbeque Sauce, Citrus-Smoked Turkey Breast and Bacon, Ham and Cheese Chicken Thighs.

3.title: Asian Smoke
3.plot: You don't think of Asia as a typical smoke cooking area. Recipes include: Char Siu Pork Tenderloin, Pork Belly Steam Buns, Soke-Braised Lamb Shank and Tangerine Smoked Flans.

4.title: Raichlen on Ribs
4.plot: A popular question is how to cook ribs. This show explains a couple of styles. Recipes include: St. Louis Ribs with Vanilla Brown Sugar Glaze, Chinatown Ribs, Onion Bombs and Rob's Real BBQ Baby Back Rib Sandwich.

5.title: Seafood Gets Smoked
5.plot: Recipes include: Smoked Shrimp and Corn Chowder, Whiskey-Cured Cold-Smoked Salmon, NOLA Smoked Shrimp and Salmon Candy.

6.title: Smoked in Four Courses
6.plot: This is how you can smoke a whole meal. Recipes include: Smoked Pecans, Chappaquiddick Smoked Oysters, Reverse Seared Prime Rib and Mango Macadamia Crisp.

7.title: Ham Sessions
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: Rise and Smoke: Breakfast Hits the Smoker
8.plot: Rising early to make breakfast on your smoker. Recipes include: Mile High Pancake, Pork Pastrami Hash, Candied Bacon and Beer Can Breakfast Burgers.

9.title: Smoke in a Hurry
9.plot: Most of us don't have a lot of time to smoke during the week. This show has dishes that you can complete in less than 10 minutes. Recipes include: Dragon's Breath Cocktail, Hay-Smoked Mozzarella (Smoked Caprese Salad), Ember Roasted Corn and Spruce-Smoked Steak.

10.title: Tropical Smoke
10.plot: Early barbecue started with the Indian barbacoa. This show pays homage to those dishes. Recipes include: Smoked Snapper Dip with Smoked Vegetable Chips, Buccaneer Chicken and Oaxacan Barbacoa.

11.title: Smokehouse Cocktail Party
11.plot: It's time to celebrate with a smokehouse cocktail party. Recipes include: Lemon Sesame Chicken Wings, Grilled Sangria and The Project Smoke "Cheesesteak"

12.title: The Big Smoke
12.plot: "Good things come in small packages" might be for jewelry but not for smoking. Recipes include: Triple Thick Pork Chops, Cape Town Lamb and Smoked Suckling Pig, Vinegar Slaw and Vinegar Sauce.

13.title: Behind the Smoke
13.plot: Let's bring smoking out of the smokehouse and into your living room, right in front of you. Recipes include: Mezcalini, Danish Smoked Shrimp, Hay-Smoked Quail Eggs, Bacon Sundaes, Smoked Chocolate Bread Pudding and Smoked Ice Cream with Rum Raisin Sauce.
